column2: 'Greece: Amazing UFO  Incident Involving Air Force and Airline02-07-2009 - Greece: Amazing UFO incident involving Air Force and AirlineMichael Cohen m.cohen@allnewsweb.comA remarkable UFO incident that occurred in the skies over Athens over a year ago but was kept secret by the Greek Aviation Authority and the Greek Air Force
column3: has recently come to light and is receiving extensive media coverage in Greece. A recording of the conversation (in Greek) between the pilot involved and the airport control tower has been made public. A copy of the official document named 'Lightning 2' commanding two F-16's to intercept the UFO can be viewed below.On 11 October
column6: the captain of Olympic Airways flight 266 from Athens to London noticed an extremely unusual object moving erratically to the west of Athens. The object was somewhat star-like in appearance
column7: however much brighter and larger with a constantly shifting shape.Meanwhile the captains of Olympic Airways flights 730 to Kos and 700 to Rhodes reported the same thing. The sighting was then confirmed by Athens Airport control tower
column8: whose employees observed the object moving towards Karystos
column9: a small town on the Greek island of Euboea. At this point the Greek Air Force was contacted.The Greek Air Force confirmed that they too were visually monitoring the object from their radar station at the top of Parintha Mountain near Athens
column10: and had observed that it was traveling at incredible speed
column11: and did not fit the description of any terrestrial craft.The staff at the Air Force radar station later described the UFO as large
column13: and very bright. Air force staff were requested to photograph the craft and did so (no pictures have come to light yet).At this point two F-16’s were sent up to intercept the UFO
column14: while the various control towers monitored the object from earth. The object then shot off at incredible speed skyward
column15: and the Jets failed to indentify anything. While both staff at the Athens Airport and the Parintha Mountain Air Force Radar Unit confirmed that they clearly observed the object their radars picked up nothing. The ensuing deliberate cover-up of this incident by the Greek authorities is being treated as fact by that country's media.Possibly the most bizarre aspect of this sighting is that although the object was witnessed simultaneously by three pilots with decades of flying experience between them
column16: staff at multiple radar and ground control stations and the Greek Air Force
column17: who actually sent jets up to chase it
column18: says it has been dismissed by some Greek Government officials as a mistaken sighting of... wait for it… Venus!This
column19: despite the fact that the captain of flight 266 remains convinced he saw a UFO. With that in mind
column20: are these Government officials  planning to request an investigation into the capability
column22: of their country's  Air Force ground control staff?  Don’t hold your breath.It is hardly surprising
column23: that if indeed aliens are visiting earth they would take an interest in Greece
column24: that cradle of western civilization. What is more surprising is western media’s complete non-coverage of this incident
column25: and the continuing and sometimes absurd attempts by governments to deny the obvious as far as UFOs are concerned. Perhaps the ancient Athenian culture of intellectual curiosity and questioning existing belief systems has been replaced by one of secrecy
column27: and the idea that the public does not have the right to know what is happening in the universe around them. '

column140: '2009 - Slovakian Police Capture UFOs on CameraVoronezh residents interviewed later claimed they had observed this UFO not just during the above incident but also many times on September 21
column143: between 6 and 9 PM.  Some of these incidents involved a different entity: small
column144: with grayish-green face and blue overcoat resembling a loose raincoat.This phenomenal account is still in need of more eyewitness testimony and research. The Voronezh landing remains an unsolved mystery.'
column148: 2009Last Sunday I had a rather strange encounter with a disturbing object in the sky above Wurzburg
column149: Germany. I was walking along the railroad lines along the river Main to scout new fishing locations. It was already pretty late
column151: I started to freeze and I wanted to move back towards the city
column152: when I noticed the silence. There was no car
column153: nothing. I stopped and looked around me. Although it was a pretty bad day to be out
column154: nature had a strange beauty in the fading daylight. Suddenly I got a strange feeling in my chest
column155: like when I was standing on a vibrating platform
column156: but only very faint. Suddenly I felt weak and then I noticed an object in the sky. It was hovering just at the base of the deep hanging clouds and disappeared every once in awhile into the moving clouds maintaining its altitude. There was no sound except some light wind
column157: only the strange humming feeling inside my body
column160: I haven't felt like that before. At first
column161: while it was still pretty close
column162: I didn't move at all. I was like in a shock. But while it slowly moved away I realized that what I was seeing might be quite unique and took out my cell phone. I wanted to take a picture but the display wasn't working right. The images had stripes and pressing the trigger didn't do anything. Only when the object was already pretty far it worked
column163: I shot the attached picture and then
column165: the disk was covered in clouds once more and I never saw it again. Here are a few facts: size: can't tell
column166: but I would guess it was pretty big
column169: are still a few hundred meters above ground
column170: so the thing should be bigger than just 10 meters. Shape: flat gray disk with lights at the bottom Height: just below the clouds/ in the clouds Time: around 6 PM
column171: dawn Speed: slowly moving across the sky Lights: three white/bluish and one red
column172: no blinking etc. Duration: very hard to tell
column173: it felt much longer than it probably was
column174: maybe 15 seconds for the whole encounter As I work for the local city administration I cannot give you my real name
column175: nobody would take me serious anymore here in Wurzburg. I never believed in aliens or UFOs
column176: but this thing got me thinking and I actually have no satisfying explanation for it. Maybe you guys know more about this thing
column177: especially because it doesn't look like the typical UFO that I have seen on the many silly photos on TV. Regards
